title: UI Improvements
description: Various UI improvements to the app

features.title: Agents require a search-files tool
features.description:
The agent calls the tool with a list of keywords, the whole project file system is searched and if any of them are found in a given file it will be returned in a final list.
The result is the list of relative file paths.

features.title: For standard agent suppliers - discover the latest prices
features.description:
It must be possible to view the latest prices per model and refresh them via a configurable link to the given supplier's website. Store the latest ones in a local file that is read on app start.
Right now the costs are always 0 - the tokens are not counted anywhere, they should be.

features.title: the word dependencies in Features and Stories should be changed to 'blockers'
features.description: This change should be reflected in any file that uses 'dependencies'

features.title: Make an Agent run chat display prettier
features.description:
make the message as a bubble, and then the tool calls as expandable rows to view the details (mainly for read_files & write_file - the rest of the tools are short enough that they can always display).
Same goes for the responses to the LLM - apply a similar view as above.

features.title: Agent run costs and times are always empty
features.description: It seems these are either not recorded correctly or not passed, so that they cannot be viewed properly inside @AgentsView.tsx and @AllAgentsView.tsx

features.title: The "Run Agent" button should be standardised
Persist locally agent runs
features.description: Make sure the history of agent runs is persisted and read when app is started

features.title: IconDelete
features.description: `IconDelete` inside @Icons.tsx needs to actually be a proper delete icon

features.title: running an agent causes an error when it tries to make a local copy of the project
features.description: shouldIgnoreCopy inside @orchestrator.ts should ignore all sorts of files and folders specific to typescript, node, electron.

features.title: Make the Context Files selection better
features.description:
1) the Add chip becomes huge once there's even just 1 file (it scales in height to match it). That shouldn't be the case.
2) when the FileSelector opens - it should auto focus into the search input box so a user can start typing right away
3) in the FileDisplay and FileSelector - instead of showing a generic document icon, let's try to use a meaningful type extension icon - if need be, create a folder with such common icons to use.
4) The FileDisplay - should show the icon centered to the left. The name in the middle. 
The file size small at the bottom.
The last modification date at the top right.
And the delete button is correct where it is now.

features.title: If any of a story's features are rejected (showing the exclamation circle) so should the story
features.description: The way this displays should follow exactly how Features are displayed inside StoryDetailsView

features.title: When running the orchestrator, finding the next feature for a story should be based on the feature index
features.description: the Story.featureIdToDisplayIndex is the means by which the features should be sorted for this.

features.title: Go over all the stories in this project and update inline file references
Standardise the Delete, Edit, Add, Create buttons
features.description:
wherever there's a button that just says Delete we should have it use the standard `DeleteIcon`
wherever there's a button that just says Add or Create we should have it use the standard `PlusIcon`
wherever there's a button that just says Edit we should have it use the standard `EditIcon`

features.title: Agents - run histories UI improvements
Toasts should animate
features.description:
Toasts need to slide down with an animation when appearing and slide up when hiding.
They need to be snappy. It should also be possible to flick them up to make them disappear (like notifications on a mobile device).

features.title: Run agent button long press
features.description: When the new Run Agent button is long pressed it should show an agent type selector - upon selection it runs with that selected agent. Normal click runs the 'developer' agent like now.

features.title: StoryCard missing RunAgent on hover
features.description:
@src/renderer/components/stories/StoryCard.tsx should have the "Run Agent" button in the top right.
Same as in @src/renderer/stories/StoriesListView.tsx if the story has a running agent - show the status.

features.title: ChatsManager should not have any agentic tools - everything should be routed through factory-ts
features.description: the factory-ts package should be the one place where all agentic tools are placed - currently @src/chat/manager.js has its own functions. Those should be cleaned up and used appropriately from factory-ts - @packages/factory-ts/src/fileTools.ts or @packages/factory-ts/src/storyUtils.ts for instance.

features.title: When running an agent - all the GIT credentials are not found in the @.env
features.description:
There is a .env file both in this project and in factory-ts.
Just like in the python counterpart ( the files @packages/factory-ts/blueprint/run_local_agent.py and @packages/factory-ts/blueprint/git_manager.py ) the GIT credentials must be loaded from the workspaces `.env` file in the root of the project.

features.title: Agent Run - UI fix
features.description: When viewing an agent run inside @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx it doesn't show the whole conversation. Just the last message. This needs to be fixed to show the full conversation.

features.title: FileMentions should be renamed RichText
features.description: This component should then be used inside Chat and inside agent runs where messages are displayed.

features.title: No edit button in Stories and Features
features.description:
In @src/renderer/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx Clicking a feature should open the edit feature form - the edit button shouldn't show.
In @src/renderer/screens/StoriesView.tsx Stories already open on click - there should just be no edit button present.

features.title: When an agent runs - there's a duplicate history run
features.description: The Electron app has its own local history run, but when the agent runs on the copy of the project - it also produces a history run. This shouldn't happen - only the original app where the agent was started should create the history run. To avoid this - the agent should simply have an extra line for these files in its .gitignore file. The histories shouldn't be removed (they were as a first fix attempt).

features.title: The agent persona markdown files are too bloated.
features.description:
These files contain the tool specs, but those are yet again repeated in the overall tool spec in the orchestrator.
These files shouldn't have the list of tools available, but the tool descriptions provided by the orchestrator should contain extra comments as to what each tool does (similarly to how each agent's markdown persona file has it).

features.title: The main FILE_ORGANISATION.md is bloated
features.description:
This file is always included and it contains irrelevant information.
Agents are asked to update this file, but they seem to always add extra unimportant info.
This needs to be tightened and made sure that the instructions for editing the file are clear, and all edits are succinct and precise.
The file should contain overall pointers to the project - not detailed descriptions of each file.
It should not be a log of changes.

features.title: Cancelled agent runs are not recorded properly
features.description: They don't change any files and are not recorded. They always show as in progress.

features.title: Agent runs should show the model
features.description: Create a reusable component - a nice display chip - that shows the provider and model.

features.title: The status display for an Agent run inside StoriesView.tsx and StoryDetailsView.tsx should match the display from AgentsView.tsx
features.description: Reuse the StatusChip inside AgentsView.tsx

features.title: In StoryDetailsView.tsx next to the play button show the Agent Model control
features.description: This control should show the current active LLM configuration and allow to quickly pick a configuration from the last 5 recent ones + a last option that would take the user to the LLM Configuration settings.

features.title: StatusChip improvements
features.description: @src/renderer/components/agents/StatusChip.tsx should only have the badge with an icon inside displaying. The status text should only show on hover as a small tooltip.

features.title: An active run should only show inside Active not History
Status and sort preferences are not stored
features.description: Whenever the user changes preferences for what to display in the StoriesView.tsx in the 'list' mode - it should store that, so at the next session it can be resumed in the same exact state.

features.title: Use the StatusChip inside AgentRunBullet
features.description: We should reuse this nice component that we have.

features.title: The ModelChip should be slimmer
features.description: Have the provider on one row and the modle name on a second row.

features.title: When editing/creating a feature allow quick file lookups
The search and sort bar for features should be placed at the top
features.description: StoryDetailsView.tsx should follow StoriesView.tsx

features.title: ChatConversation improvements
features.description: @src/renderer/components/agents/ChatConversation.tsx  is currently broken - there was a new type AgentFeatureRunLog introduced inside AgentRun in the file @src/renderer/services/agentsService.ts . Adapt everything in ChatConversation to make it work. Display a list of features in an AgentRun, each Feature run showing the 'turns'. After the first initial message, each turn is a series of 2 messages - 1 from the LLM and 1 a response with tool calls. The final message is a single one from the LLM. Make sure the orchestrator works correctly too.

features.title: Reference and File lookup usability improvements
features.description:
When the user types # for references and @ for files to be looked up in the @src/renderer/components/ui/FileMentionsTextarea.tsx if the user presses space while the lookup is showing - auto pick the top result.
Also, for references - they should always display in the text as #{story_index}.{feature_index} - the user will most likely search for the features by these indices.

features.title: After running a first agent, running any more stalls
features.description:
Any consecutive agent after the first never starts.
Cancelling an agent from the @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx   screen doesn't help either.

The last message in the log is:
[factory] SUBSCRIBE

I can see this message in the agent run log:
"message": "Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/var/folders/25/4dns7s115_q13z992np622qw0000gn/T/factory-ts-A3L8P3/workspace/projects/main.json'\n    at async open (node:internal/fs/promises:639:25)\n    at async Object.readFile (node:internal/fs/promises:1243:14)\n    at async Object.getProjectDir (file:///packages/factory-ts/dist/storyUtils.js:18:17)\n    at async runIsolatedOrchestrator (file:///Users/cloud/Documents/Work/TheFactory/projects/overseer-local/packages/factory-ts/dist/orchestrator.js:489:24)\n    at async file:///packages/factory-ts/dist/index.js:197:17",


And I can see a warning in the console:
MaxListenersExceededWarning: Possible EventEmitter memory leak detected. 11 files:subscribe listeners added.

features.title: ChatConversation improvements
features.description: @src/renderer/components/agents/ChatConversation.tsx  doesn't update while an agent is running. I have to close the popup and open it to see the latest messages. This shouldn't be the case - it should keep on scrolling down the messages if the user is at the bottom, and if not - keep on adding them.

features.title: AgentsView and AllAgentsView improvements
features.description:
In  @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx  the active and history runs should be sorted by date - the most recent at the top

Also, both in @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx and in @src/renderer/screens/AllAgentsView.tsx it shouldn't show the Turn column, but instead show how many features were completed out of how many.

In @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx in the active runs, there should be no Status column, but an additional Thinking column before duration that should update with the time the agent is taking to answer the last message.

features.title: Allow moving stories when in 'not-done'
After closing the app and coming back none of the agent run histories show messages properly
features.description: It seems there's an issue with the way the messages are serialized in @packages/factory-ts/src/orchestrator.ts , the display is in @src/renderer/components/agents/ChatConversation.tsx . Remember, the messages that are passed onto the LLM are in a strict format - they have to specify role as 'user'. For history purposes, the serialisation should add appropraite metadata information to make it easier to display later.

features.title: Shortcuts in the app were disabled because they interfered with typing in the "/" character
features.description: A user must be able to specify which key is the modifier key in settings - @src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx . Bring back the shortcuts - @src/renderer/App.tsx

features.title: When no features are in a story - the default agent type is "speccer"
features.description: This should be true no matter where it is run from, right now it's only via @src/renderer/components/stories/RunAgentButton.tsx

features.title: This feature is index 1 - we should have a special quick command wherever in the app for adding a feature to this story only
Notifications should fire when an agent finishes work
features.description:
Also when a feature is completed (i.e. a commit is made).
The @src/renderer/services/notificationsService.ts is responsible as well @src/notifications/manager.js    

These should be toggle'able in @src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx

features.title: It must be possible to remove agent runs from history
features.description: The agent runs in @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx or in @src/renderer/screens/AllAgentsView.tsx

features.title: There needs to be an edit button next to the button for new story
features.description: This is inside @src/renderer/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx - it must be possible to edit a story from within this view. Deleting a story here, would take the user back to Home.

features.title: Show a summary of running agents per project in the sidebar
features.description:
This should also be visible when the sidebar is minimized - it should show the project icon and this new chip that would display the number of agents.
@src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx

features.title: It must be possible to select the icon for a given project
features.description: Create a directory of helpful icons and allow a user to pick from one when they create or edit a project @src/renderer/projects/ProjectManagerModal.tsx - this is then shown in the @src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx

features.title: AgentsView shows the thinking time incorrectly
features.description: When the 'run/heartbeat' event is received from @packages/factory-ts/src/orchestrator.ts it seems to make the display reset the thinking time counter. The counter should be purely based on the time the last message was received and the time now. This is for @src/renderer/components/agents/AgentRunRow.tsx

features.title: Lookup fix
features.description: When using the file lookup when typing in @ in the description of a feature, the user has to type in space twice or more for it to allow to type further. One space should be enough, and it should put the caret one space further than the filename. This logic is in @src/renderer/hooks/useFilesAutocomplete.ts and displayed in @src/renderer/components/ui/RichText.tsx

features.title: Story lookup fix
features.description:
When using story lookup, it doesn't allow the user to search by typing in "1.1" for instance. The moment the user types in the "." the dropdown disappears. The logic is in @src/renderer/hooks/useReferencesAutocomplete.ts and used inside @src/renderer/components/ui/RichText.tsx 

Also, when typing in "#8" for instance - it incorrectly references the blocker - the user types in the reference, but the blocker should actually hold the proper id information (so reverse lookup must be done).

features.title: when switching views - the prefs for which view is stored in StoriesView is lost
features.description: When switching screens from the @src/renderer/screens/StoriesView.tsx to any other of the screens in the @src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx it resets the previous status selection and sorting selection. This shouldn't happen - these preferences must be kept.

features.title: Typing in "?" shows the help menu
features.description:
The user has to click Shift+"?" and it shows the help menu - it should do that for Shift+"H".
All these shortcuts, along the modifier key should be configurable in @src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx

features.title: when searching commands in the search input box in CommandMenu.tsx it must be possible to use arrows to go up/down and select the appropriate command
features.description:
The input box inside @src/renderer/components/ui/CommandMenu.tsx 
 should be a single line input - so the user cannot go up and down in there. Using up and down arrows selects different items in the results list below the input box.
So the user types in "Go", the results filter all the results for that and its possible to select whichever result the user wants and hit enter to activate it.
The first time up is pressed - the bottom result should be selected.
The first time down is pressed - the top result should be selected.
Once something is selected, but the user types more - just keep the selection within min/max of 0 and results length -1

features.title: Tooltip accessibility and robustness improvements
features.description:
Make Tooltip component ARIA-correct and safe for multiple instances.

Implementation details (src/renderer/components/ui/Tooltip.tsx):
- Generate a unique id per tooltip instance (e.g., useId) and assign it to the tooltip element; set anchor 'aria-describedby' to that id when open.
- Remove hardcoded 'aria-describedby'='tooltip'.
- Add Escape key handling to hide when focused on the anchor.
- Ensure role=tooltip and correct z-index are preserved.

Acceptance criteria:
- Two adjacent buttons using Tooltip both show their own content and 'aria-describedby' points to their unique tooltip id when open.
- Pressing Escape while the anchor has focus hides the tooltip.
- No duplicate id usage across multiple tooltip instances.

features.title: Modal accessibility: aria-labelledby/aria-describedby and scroll lock
features.description:
Improve Modal semantics and body scroll behavior.

Implementation details (src/renderer/components/ui/Modal.tsx):
- Give the title element a unique id and wire 'aria-labelledby' on the dialog to that id when title exists.
- Allow optional description id wiring via 'aria-describedby' (useful from AlertDialog when description is provided).
- Lock body scrolling while a modal is open (set document.body.style.overflow='hidden') and restore on close/unmount.

Acceptance criteria:
- Screen readers announce the modal title and description upon opening.
- While a modal is open, the page behind it cannot scroll; once closed, body scrolling returns to its previous state.
- Existing focus trapping and Escape behavior remain intact.

features.title: Dynamic modifier glyphs in shortcuts UI and command menu
features.description:
Render keyboard shortcuts using the user-selected modifier (Cmd vs Ctrl) consistently.

Implementation details:
- Enhance src/renderer/hooks/useShortcuts.tsx to expose a read-only getter for the current modifier (e.g., export function getShortcutsModifier(): 'meta' | 'ctrl').
- Update src/renderer/components/ui/ShortcutsHelp.tsx and src/renderer/components/ui/CommandMenu.tsx to format displayed shortcuts based on the current modifier, replacing hardcoded 'Cmd/Ctrl' strings (e.g., show 'âŒ˜K' on mac modifier and 'Ctrl+K' otherwise).

Acceptance criteria:
- Changing the shortcuts modifier in app settings (after reload, consistent with current provider behavior) updates the displayed shortcut glyphs in ShortcutsHelp and CommandMenu.
- All visible shortcut hints reflect the correct modifier (no "Cmd/Ctrl" placeholders).

features.title: CollapsibleSidebar semantics: use buttons for actionable items
features.description:
Improve navigation item semantics for better accessibility.

Implementation details (src/renderer/components/ui/CollapsibleSidebar.tsx):
- Replace the inner div with role="button" for each clickable nav item with an actual <button> element, preserving current classes and event handlers.
- Keep roving tabindex behavior and keyboard activation (Enter/Space) intact, but rely on native button semantics.
- Ensure aria-current or aria-selected is still used appropriately.

Acceptance criteria:
- Keyboard navigation (ArrowUp/ArrowDown/Home/End + Enter/Space activation) works as before.
- Screen readers announce items as buttons within navigation; no loss of functionality.
- No regression in compact/collapsed behavior and badges/actions rendering.

features.title: StoriesListView: skeletons for initial loading state
features.description:
Replace text-only loading state with skeleton placeholders for a smoother UX.

Implementation details (src/renderer/stories/StoriesListView.tsx):
- When isAppSettingsLoaded is false, render a list of ~6 skeleton rows using src/renderer/components/ui/Skeleton.tsx to approximate story rows' layout (id/status area, title/desc lines, and actions area blocks).
- Keep current "Loading settingsâ€¦" live region messaging accessible (aria-live politely) in the count area.

Acceptance criteria:
- Before settings are loaded, story area shows skeleton placeholders instead of a static 'Loading...' string.
- Once loaded, skeletons disappear and the real content renders.
- No layout shift beyond expected content replacement.

features.title: Consistent focus-visible styling on interactive elements
features.description:
Ensure keyboard users see a consistent focus outline across buttons, nav items, and inputs.

Implementation details:
- Update CSS (src/index.css) to provide a consistent :focus-visible ring/outline for .btn, .btn-secondary, .btn-icon, .nav-item, .nav-toggle, .nav-trigger, .ui-select trigger, inputs, and other clickable UI controls.
- Do not override focus when using mouse; rely on :focus-visible.

Acceptance criteria:
- Tabbing through the UI shows clear, consistent focus outlines on all interactive controls mentioned.
- Mouse users do not see focus outlines unless they keyboard-focus an element (focus-visible behavior).

features.title: New section in settings - configuring WebSearch Api keys for exa, serpapi and tavily
features.description:
This must be a new options section in @src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx .
It must be persisted and the user can put in a key for each of the tools and save it.

features.title: Use the configuration of WebSearch api keys - exa, serpapi and tavily
features.description:
We are storing the api keys to these inside @src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx - we need to use them in  'thefactory-tools' that has webSearch tooling.
The places where these new apiKeys can be provided is inside @src/chat/ChatsManager.js when calling 'buildChatTools' inside 'getCompletion'; and in @src/tools/factory/mainOrchestrator.js when calling 'orchestrator.startRun' .

features.title: New Section in Settings - configuring github credentials
features.description:
This must be a new options section in @src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx .
It must be persisted and the user can put in a username and a personal token.
It has to be persisted across sessions.

features.title: LiveData providers are project specific or global
features.description:
Make it possible to configure a LiveDataProvider as global or targeting  the project it's being made in - the views are in @src/renderer/screens/LiveDataView.tsx .
Currently we have the Agent prices provider - this should be global, as it gets the prices that all LLM agent runs use to show the cost per token.
There's a 2nd provider currently configured for this project - the BTC price getter - that one should be specific to this project (Overseer Local).
Responsible classes are:
@src/renderer/hooks/useLiveData.tsx and @src/renderer/services/liveDataService.ts

features.title: Loading screen
features.description:
We need a loading screen that will show at the beginning of app launch, while all necessary things are being loaded. This needs to be a separate screen - placed under `src/renderer/screens` just like @src/renderer/screens/StoriesView.tsx . The app entry is in @src/renderer/App.tsx .
For the time being - make sure the loading screen loads the user preferences and app settings - @src/renderer/hooks/useAppSettings.ts

features.title: when switching projects - go to the base of a given screen
AppSettings needs an AppSettingsContext
features.description:
Same as @src/renderer/contexts/ProjectContext.tsx , created in @src/renderer/App.tsx ; and then used in @src/renderer/hooks/useProjectSettings.ts we need the same exact approach for @src/renderer/hooks/useAppSettings.ts . It essentially needs to be a singleton used across the project and this will make sure that's the case.
AppSettings should be such a context of the first level.

features.title: useLLMConfig should be an app wide context
features.description: Make @src/renderer/hooks/useLLMConfig.ts follow the same pattern as @src/renderer/contexts/AppSettingsContext.tsx and @src/renderer/contexts/ProjectContext.tsx to turn it into a context initialised once in @src/renderer/App.tsx

features.title: turn useAgents into a context
features.description: Make @src/renderer/hooks/useAgents.ts .ts follow the same pattern as @src/renderer/contexts/AppSettingsContext.tsx  and @src/renderer/contexts/ProjectContext.tsx  to turn it into a context initialised once in @src/renderer/App.tsx

features.title: turn useFiles into context
features.description: Make @src/renderer/hooks/useFiles.tsx follow the same pattern as @src/renderer/contexts/AppSettingsContext.tsx   and @src/renderer/contexts/ProjectContext.tsx   to turn it into a context initialised once in @src/renderer/App.tsx .

features.title: turn useStories into a context
features.description: Make @src/renderer/hooks/useStories.tsx follow the same pattern as @src/renderer/contexts/AppSettingsContext.tsx    and @src/renderer/contexts/ProjectContext.tsx    to turn it into a context initialised once in @src/renderer/App.tsx  .

features.title: Allow rating of runs
features.description:
In @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx there needs to be a new column 'rating' left to the actions buttons.
If an 'AgentRunHistory' doesn't have a rating, it shows two buttons (vertically stacked) - a thumbs up and a thumbs down - that are hollow icons. On hover, they are filled with color (green for up and red for down). When clicking, it needs to call via @src/renderer/contexts/AgentsContext.tsx the 'rateRun' functions from @src/renderer/services/factoryService.ts . Once a run has a rating (1 for up, 0 for down), it should only show the filled in button displaying the rating. If a user clicks a rating that was done - it will remove the rating.

features.title: Model statistics
features.description:
In @src/renderer/screens/AllAgentsView.tsx we need to display statistics per model and per project. We don't need to display all the runs like it is showing right now - that's already shown in each project's individual @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx .

Statistics we require - overall average costs that are shown now.

Overall cheapest model on average, overall most expensive model on average, overall fastest model on average (per feature duration), overall slowest model on average (per feature duration), overall model with highest average rating, overall model with lowest average rating.

Just the same as all these overall stats - we want to display the same per project.

All in a nice scrollable table similar to what's already shown right now.

features.title: Apply formatter on save
features.description:
When using VSCode and saving a file the project needs to auto apply a formatter so that all code is always in the same style.
We also need to have a script under /scripts that can be run on all files to make sure they have the format applied.

features.title: Apply formatter on git commit
features.description: Whenever a commit happens - it needs to have a formatter be applied before the code ends up being pushed or seen by other users.

features.title: AllAgents statistics rework
features.description:
In @src/renderer/screens/AllAgentsView.tsx there needs to be a few improvements:
1) the overall section should be the top row of the "Projects statistics" section. It should have a blueish background to make it stand out from the project ones.
2) Move the "Projects statistics" above "Model statistics"
3) Make the "Model statistics" match "Projects statistics in terms of columns as much as possible
4) Add a section "Agents statistics" that similarly to per project stats will have the same breakdown but per agentType.
5) Replace the active runs item from the top with a total time spent by agents.

features.title: AllAgentsView rework
features.description:
In @src/renderer/screens/AllAgentsView.tsx we need to rework the following:
1) remove the Overall highlights
2) the projects statistics:
- the Overall row (the 1st one) needs to have a light blue background.
3) all sections:
 - Fastest (per feature), Slowest (per feature) columns, should have the text on 2 lines. The second line saying "(pre feature)"
- The values for columns showing a model chip + cost should have them vertically stacked, so the model chip first and below it the cost.
4) at the top, remove the avg cost per run - add instead a total stories/features worked on

features.title: Make the app icon work
features.description:
There's an icon included 'icon.jpeg' in the root of this project.
Make it work as the app's icon.

features.title: Cleanup the SettingsView
features.description:
The @src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx is currently overloaded by its sub views.
Each subview should be in its own separate folder as it serves as a separate main view. Refactor it cleanly.

features.title: Managers.js could be typed
features.description:
@src/managers.js could be turned into a typescript file so that we can use all the typing niceties also in all of the managers:
@src/chat/ChatsManager.js , @src/db/DatabaseManager.js , @src/document_ingestion/DocumentIngestionManager.js , @src/factory-tools/FactoryToolsManager.js , @src/files/FilesManager.js , @src/git-monitor/GitMonitorManager.js , @src/live-data/liveDataManager.js , @src/notifications/NotificationsManager.js , @src/stories/StoriesManager.js  , @src/projects/ProjectsManager.js  , @src/settings/SettingsManager.js

features.title: Replace all the emoji icons in the Sidebar with icons specific to this project
features.description:
They should all reside alongside other icons in @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx .
Update @src/renderer/components/ui/CollapsibleSidebar.tsx and @src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx .
Keep it according to style defined in @docs/styleguide/README.md  and @docs/design/DESIGN_SYSTEM.md , @docs/design/DESIGN_TOKENS.md , @docs/design/MONDAY_PALETTE_REFERENCE.md  and @docs/ux/LINEAR_UX_GUIDELINES.md

features.title: All the domain managers could be typed
features.description:
All of the managers could be typed and extend the base defined in @src/managers.ts . The managers:
@src/chat/ChatsManager.js  , @src/db/DatabaseManager.js  , @src/document_ingestion/DocumentIngestionManager.js  , @src/factory-tools/FactoryToolsManager.js  , @src/files/FilesManager.js  , @src/git-monitor/GitMonitorManager.js  , @src/live-data/liveDataManager.js  , @src/notifications/NotificationsManager.js  , @src/stories/StoriesManager.js   , @src/projects/ProjectsManager.js   , @src/settings/SettingsManager.js

features.title: Icons need to be more colorful
features.description: All the icons used in the @src/renderer/components/ui/CollapsibleSidebar.tsx and @src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx from @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx need to be more colorful.

features.title: ProjectsModal must match icon style of new icons
features.description: The icons for projects inside @src/projects/ProjectsManager.ts that are set per project must match the new icons in @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx that are used in @src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx

features.title: We need more project icons
features.description: There should be at least 20 various icons in @src/renderer/projects/projectIcons.ts . Also, when a project's icon is set - it should be reflected in @src/renderer/components/ui/CollapsibleSidebar.tsx and @src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx

features.title: Emoji icons
features.description: There are old emojis inside @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx - they need to be translated into the svg icons in that file, and then used in the list for project icons inside @src/renderer/projects/projectIcons.tsx

features.title: When a feature has a rejection then a story is not-done
features.description: No matter what the status of the Story, if there's any feature with a rejection - the Story should also show in the @src/renderer/screens/StoriesView.tsx when "not-done" is selected

features.title: Icons need to be more colorful
features.description: All icons in @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx that are black and white - i.e. ones that don't have 'stroke'/'fill' directly set in their svg lines/circles/rects need to be reworked to be colorful like the sidebar icons "IconHome", "IconFiles" or "IconChat" for example.

features.title: Show the notifications badge in the Sidebar
features.description:
Right now, next to the project in the @src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx it only shows a running agent badge. It must also show the notifications badge next to it.
When the Sidebar is collapsed - it should shrink both badges and show them vertically stacked - making sure that the project icon is still clearly visible.

The Notifications button also has a NotificationBadge but it's wrapped in a Tooltip - @src/renderer/components/ui/Tooltip.tsx and it doesn't get centred correctly like the project buttons do.

All the project buttons should also be wrapped in this Tooltip when collapsed and display the project name in the tooltip.

features.title: In all modals - the footer/bottom section is sticky just like the top/header section
features.description:
Right now, for instance in @src/renderer/components/stories/FeatureForm.tsx there are buttons at the bottom that get hidden if the form is too big - these need to be sticky at the bottom so they always show (just like the top section).
This needs to be true for all modals - so that any place using a modal can define the bottom sticky section. Then only the middle section scrolls.
@src/renderer/projects/ProjectManagerModal.tsx also should have the sticky bottom buttons.
The interface for doing so should be clean and consistent.

features.title: When a feature is modified or added to a story the story status should update
features.description: In @src/renderer/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx when a new feature is added, the Story's status might still be "Done" even though the underlying Story data has changed - the view should update accordingly (by getting the latest story data).

features.title: Error when opening AllAgentsView when an agent is running
features.description:
When opening @src/renderer/screens/AllAgentsView.tsx  while an agent is running this error occurs:

AllAgentsView.tsx:42 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'flatMap')
    at AllAgentsView.tsx:42:10
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at AllAgentsView.tsx:40:30
    at AllAgentsView (AllAgentsView.tsx:37:17)
(anonymous)	@	AllAgentsView.tsx:42
(anonymous)	@	AllAgentsView.tsx:40
AllAgentsView	@	AllAgentsView.tsx:37
hashchange		
(anonymous)	@	Navigator.tsx:133
(anonymous)	@	SidebarView.tsx:211
onClick	@	SidebarView.tsx:365

features.title: Settings inner sidebar needs to have icons updated
features.description: Just like everywhere else - we are using icons from @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx or @src/renderer/projects/projectIcons.tsx . Make sure the icons used for categories or anywhere else in @src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx are used from @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx  (if they don't exist - create one).

features.title: Notifications need to update their icons
features.description: The inner sidebar in @src/renderer/screens/NotificationsView.tsx need to have their icons updated and used from @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx . If an icon doesn't exist - it should be created according to design.

features.title: ChatsView needs to have icons updated
features.description: The inner sidebar in @src/renderer/screens/ChatView.tsx need to have their icons updated and used from @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx  . If an icon doesn't exist - it should be created according to design.

features.title: Update icons in FilesView
features.description: The inner sidebar in @src/renderer/screens/FilesView.tsx  need to have their icons updated and used from @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx   . If an icon doesn't exist - it should be created according to design.

features.title: Write a script under /scripts that will alter the dates of stories/features
features.description: We need a scripts @scripts/alter_dates.ts that will accept two paths as a parameter - first for the stories folder and second for the project.json. When run, will get all the story.json files from  that folder. Put all the features that are completed (have a completedAt) in an array - sort them by story display id (from the project.json - that is a ProjectSpec ) and starting from the one with the highest id, start offsetting each next feature's completedAt by a random amount between 10min and 2hr back in time. Then go over all the story files and update the features by their new completedAt - and also the story should have its completedAt set to value that is the highest amongst its features (if all the features are completed).

features.title: The Timeline icon in Icons needs to be improved
features.description: In @src/renderer/components/ui/Icons.tsx fix the TimelineIcon - always follow the same designs as the rest of the icons

features.title: Make it possible to configure github credentials per project
features.description:
Just like with LLM settings in @src/renderer/screens/settings/llms/LLMSettings.tsx we want to store multiple github credentials and then each project when being created or edited (in @src/renderer/projects/ProjectManagerModal.tsx ) can optionally have them set (the id of the credentials would be stored in the ProjectSpec metadata). 
So the @src/renderer/screens/settings/github/GitHubSettings.tsx  needs to be reworked to accomodate too.

features.title: Show the same topbar in AgentsView as in AllAgentsView
features.description: @src/renderer/screens/AllAgentsView.tsx has this bar at the top with run statistics - we want to display the exact same per project inside @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx

features.title: In Timeline the Today button doesn't work correctly
features.description: In @src/renderer/screens/ProjectTimelineView.tsx the Today button needs to scroll the user to the correct spot in each timeline (Day | Week | Month) - currently it's broken.

features.title: When switching view modes always show today's date
features.description: In @src/renderer/screens/ProjectTimelineView.tsx when the app opens and when switching modes between DAY | WEEK | MONTH - always make sure today's date is visible (so as if the user pressed the "Today" button).

features.title: When there are any changes in creating/editing a story or feature confirm
features.description: In @src/renderer/components/stories/FeatureForm.tsx and @src/renderer/components/stories/StoryForm.tsx that are used in @src/renderer/stories/FeatureCreateView.tsx , @src/renderer/stories/FeatureEditView.tsx , @src/renderer/stories/StoryCreateView.tsx and @src/renderer/stories/StoryEditView.tsx - make sure that if there are any changes whatsoever to the form, and the user clicks out or in some way tries to close the popup - an alert is displayed saying that there are pending changes and if the user really wants to discard them all and close the popup. The Alert must have a red/destructive "DISCARD ALL" button and a standard "Go Back" button - only clicking either of these buttons can close the alert.

features.title: The spinner doesn't spin
features.description: Whenever the user is presented with a spinner it doesn't animate

features.title: In StoriesListView when a Story has an agent running - always show it
features.description: The agent running should show always - not just on hover on a story row in @src/renderer/stories/StoriesListView.tsx  in @src/renderer/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx it's also slightly wrong, as the @src/renderer/components/agents/AgentRunBullet.tsx should replace @src/renderer/components/stories/RunAgentButton.tsx - i.e. it should occupy the same space - it should simply NEVER disappear when there's a task running.

features.title: when clicking Start Run on a Story row in StoriesListView - don't go to StoryDetailsView
features.description: Currently when clicking start run in @src/renderer/stories/StoriesListView.tsx it will go to the @src/renderer/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx screen. Clearly the click is somehow propagating - it shouldn't.

features.title: Improve the time display in ChatConversation to show a time display similar to AgentRows
features.description: In @src/renderer/components/agents/ChatConversation.tsx it always shows the time taken to respond in seconds - we want it to be more human friendly, so it should always show it in the h:mm:ss format, and now show h or mm if the time is small enough - it should be done similarly in @src/renderer/components/agents/AgentRunRow.tsx

features.title: The Sidebar has grown - make the top with the title stay stick and only the rest scroll
features.description: @src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx

features.title: Sometimes when a running agent finishes it hangs
features.description: A 'finishFeature' tool call can be seen as received and the agent has finished (all the commits have gone through) but yet, in @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx there is a running agent showing. After restarting this app - the agent no longer shows as running. It seems there's an issue in @src/renderer/contexts/AgentsContext.tsx with how it stores finished agents?

features.title: when a file is added while the app is running it's not picked up
features.description: when using @src/renderer/hooks/useFilesAutocomplete.ts a new file doesn't show - there must be some disconnect with @src/renderer/contexts/FilesContext.tsx

features.title: The timeline doesn't filter by projectId
features.description:
When switching to different projects while having the @src/renderer/screens/ProjectTimelineView.tsx open it keeps on showing stories/features for all projects.
It should only show the stories/feature for the given project.
Displaying stories/features for all proejcts should be controlled by a toggle left to the Day|Week|Month buttons. When switching projects, the timeline should show today (i.e. same behaviour as if the Today button was clicked).

features.title: The AllAgentsView should be merged into Agents
features.description: We need to have a toggle at the top right of the @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx that will either show the current project's runs (what @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx is currently showing) or for all projects (what @src/renderer/screens/AllAgentsView.tsx is showing) . The All Agents option from the sidebar can be removed

features.title: The settings should be in a footer at the bottom of the sidebar
features.description: Same as the header - it shouldn't scroll - only the button in between should.

features.title: when an agent is running move the spinner
features.description:
In @src/renderer/stories/StoriesListView.tsx when an agent is running for a story and showing the @src/renderer/components/agents/AgentRunBullet.tsx - place the bullet to the left of the Story's Id chip (similarly to how the blocked indicator is placed next to the feature's chip).
Make the action buttons show on hover always (when an agent is running do not show the Run agent button).
We need a very similar layout update in @src/renderer/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx where the @src/renderer/components/agents/AgentRunBullet.tsx needs to move below the status chip for a given feature.

features.title: 'thefactory-tools' exposes a new ProjectCodeInfo - use it
features.description:
Essentially, each ProjectSpec has a new field `codeInfo` that should be configurable via @src/renderer/projects/ProjectManagerModal.tsx . The new types are referenced in a comment in @src/renderer/services/projectsService.ts .
If `codeInfo` is present in a ProjectSpect it means it's a coding project. We must allow users to toggle to a coding project via a switch - then a small popup with dropdowns for language, framework and test framework should appear. If the user exits this popup (with no items selected) - the project gets switched back to a non-coding project one. If there is `codeInfo` in a ProjectSpec then 3 chips need to show with the appropriate info side-by-side in a row. Clicking on any of the chips will open the selector popup mentioned previously but this time with some values preselected.

features.title: ProjectManagerModal codeInfo improvements
features.description:
The Chip inside @src/renderer/projects/ProjectManagerModal.tsx was never implemented (I simply wired it to a button). So the modal itself looks bad.
This chip needs to be implemented for each item of `codeInfo` .
For the languages it should display the image of the language. These icons should be stored somewhere - similarly to @src/renderer/projects/projectIcons.tsx we can have @src/renderer/projects/codeInfoIcons.tsx .

Also, when editing the items inside @src/renderer/projects/ProjectCodeInfoModal.tsx - some of the lists are so long they end up being clipped by the edge of the app. The list should always be placed below the buttons, be scrollable and of some manageable max size.

features.title: the sidebar hide/show button needs improving
features.description:
When it is showing the arrow needs to point down, when hidden like now pointing right.
The transition needs to animate.

features.title: the coverage table in TestsView should be horizontally scrollable
features.description:
Right now the table in @src/renderer/screens/TestsView.tsx - so the @src/renderer/components/tests/CoverageReport.tsx - expands the whole screen to the right - it shouldn't. it should scroll to the right if it grows too big.
It's the first column that grows wildly - because some names can be long - but still, the table should have a set size, and only the content within should scroll - the header and the rows.

features.title: after upgrading to new Electron version - modal css/colors are missing
features.description:
When displaying a popup like @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureCreateView.tsx the background is missing the right color (whitish). Inside the 
@src/renderer/src/components/stories/FeatureForm.tsx the file chips are also not displaying properly like they used to.

features.title: Mobile/Small UI improvements
features.description:
In @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx some things need to be shifted.
The blockers incoming/outgoing at the top should be in a section between the title section and the search section (so an entirely new section). This should only show if there's a blocker either outgoing or incoming.
The add feature button (with the plus) should be in the top right of the `Features` section - horizontally leveled with the title of that section. The edit button (for the whole story) should be in the top right of the `Overview` section - horizontally leveled with the tile of that section.
Now the search secton will have 3 elements left - the search bar, that status filter and the ordering selection. The latter 2 should be pushed to a 2nd row if the screen becomes small enough so that in the mobile version it shows the search bar at the top and status filter + ordering selection below it.

features.title: StoriesListView UI update
features.description:
When the screen becomes small @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoriesListView.tsx gets a menu bar at the top. We actually want that to be visible all the time, and to show Home to the left like it does in the mobile version.
The bar should have the List | Board switch in the middle of it and the model selection chip + chat button to the right.
The search section will then contain 3 elements - the search bar, the status filer and the ordering selection. When the screen becomes small enough ,the latter two need to be pushed to a 2nd row, so in the mobile version there will be the search bar visible on one row and the status filer and ordering selection visible on the 2nd row.

features.title: The Files don't display
features.description:
For instance in @src/renderer/src/components/stories/FeatureForm.tsx it uses the @src/renderer/src/components/stories/ContextFileChip.tsx which in turn uses @src/renderer/src/components/ui/FileDisplay.tsx , which is a `FilePreviewCard` wrapped in a @src/renderer/src/components/ui/Tooltip.tsx . When these are displayed in the @src/renderer/src/components/stories/FeatureForm.tsx for some files - they don't show at all - just the 'x' (the delete button) shows.
When debugging it seems that the Tooltip never gets to render the `FilePreviewCard` so there must be some bug in there.

features.title: The Feature form is not scrollable
features.description: The @src/renderer/src/components/stories/FeatureForm.tsx inside @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureCreateView.tsx and @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureEditView.tsx is not scrollable - it should be.

features.title: When rating an agent run - make it an optimistic local update and show an animation
features.description:
In @src/renderer/src/screens/AgentsView.tsx , when clicking one of the ratings on an @src/renderer/src/components/agents/AgentRunRow.tsx - this operation might take a while to complete, which means that right now it takes a while before the UI updates.
We need to make it be an optimistic update (so ui updates immediately) and show a nice popping animation of the icon with it rotating and emitting sparks. There are many references to a similar animation to how games do it - this should be similar.
While animating - the rating buttons should be disabled.

features.title: DocumentIngestionManager should check for text files
features.description: When calling `ingestProject` @src/logic/document_ingestion/DocumentIngestionManager.ts should make sure that only text files are passed onto the database manager as only those are processed.

features.title: Deleting/updating/creating features/stories should be optimistic
features.description: When using @src/renderer/src/components/stories/FeatureForm.tsx in @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureCreateView.tsx and @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureEditView.tsx , as well as @src/renderer/src/components/stories/StoryForm.tsx in @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryCreateView.tsx and @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryEditView.tsx - all the changes should be optimistic as the backend changes might take a a little bit of time to update, whereas the user should have immediate visual feedback.

features.title: The AlertDialog when showing the destructiveConfirm doesn't display anything
features.description: The button in AlertDialog (which is in @src/renderer/src/components/ui/Modal.tsx ) is not visible.

features.title: when an agent finishes two notifications show
features.description: there must be a bug somewhere in @src/renderer/src/contexts/AgentsContext.tsx

features.title: File context chips show "file not found" and wrong time and size
features.description:
The @src/renderer/src/components/stories/ContextFileChip.tsx shows file not found - even though a correct file path is being fed to it that came from @src/renderer/src/hooks/useFilesAutocomplete.ts .
Also, when displaying the full one in a form like @src/renderer/src/components/stories/FeatureForm.tsx - it doesn't show the size or last update time correctly.

features.title: Clicking an open ModelChip should close it
features.description: A @src/renderer/src/components/agents/ModelChip.tsx that is clicked once it's been opened should close.

features.title: Test tools allow running e2e tests
StoryCreateView and StoryEditView should use footer buttons
features.description: Following @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureEditView.tsx , @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryCreateView.tsx and @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryEditView.tsx should have it use the modal footer in the same way instead of creating their own buttons in the form.

features.title: Agents need to display the new updated AgentRun Messages
features.description: in @src/renderer/src/screens/AgentsView.tsx the @src/renderer/src/components/agents/ChatConversation.tsx needs to show the new updated results correctly

features.title: Clicking ctrl/cmd+F adds a default Ongoing Improvements - but not always
features.description:
When a different project other than 'main' is selected and the user does cmd+f to create an "ongoing improvements" feature - the success toast shows, but the feature isn't created.
Due to reading the `activeProject` in @src/renderer/src/contexts/StoriesContext.tsx it only works when the main project is selected.
To fix this we need two improvements:
- 1st, ctrl/cmd+f should create the feature in the given project in that projects 'ongoing improvements' story. If it doesn't exist it should simply be created and recorded.
- 2nd, ctrl/cmd+g should create the feature in 'main' NO MATTER WHICH is the active project.

features.title: Agents need to display running agents correctly
features.description: After a single turn an agent disappears. The schema has changed.

features.title: Add ProjectChip + StoryChip to forms
features.description:
There are 2 story forms @src/renderer/src/components/stories/StoryForm.tsx  used in @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryCreateView.tsx , @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryEditView.tsx , and and 2 feature forms @src/renderer/src/components/stories/FeatureForm.tsx used in @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureEditView.tsx and @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureCreateView.tsx .
Under the title all of these need to display a project chip info (that cannot be clicked) aligned to the left with the title. The project chip is @src/renderer/src/components/agents/ProjectChip.tsx .

The feature views also need to display a @src/renderer/src/components/stories/DependencyBullet.tsx where the dependency is the `storyId` to the right of the form aligned with the Status display.
